page.title: 01Introducing Area 0412 0522
page.content: Our area is a very rural part of Co. Durham with two small areas of population namely the village of Cockfield to the N.W. and part of Evenwood to the N.E. plus a few inhabitants in the hamlets of Wackerfield, Burnt Houses and Esperley.It is an undulating area, the highest point being 220 m. above sea level.The nearest towns are Darlington 13 miles away to the S.E. Bishop Auckland 7 miles away to the E. and Barnard Castle 6 miles to the S.W. . 1985 sees the area dominated by opencast mining on the site of the now empty Buckhead farm.The area's other principal feature is The Fell, but it also contains many farms,2 of which are featured on later pages.There are 3 small factories,most employment is found out of the area and there is much unemployment among the young.
